This function only works if the agent is currently on a charging cell.">

## predict

Args:
    surv_id (int): The unique ID of the survivor.
    label (int): The predicted label/classification for the survivor.">
<PyParameter name="surv_id" type="int">
  
</PyParameter>
<PyParameter name="label" type="np.int32">
  
</PyParameter>
<PyFunctionReturn type="None">

</PyFunctionReturn>
</PyFunction>
## send_message

<PyFunction docString="Send a message to specified destination agents on the same team, excluding self.

Args:
    message (str): The content of the message to send.
    dest_ids (list[int]): List of agent IDs to send the message to. If empty, message is broadcast to team excluding self.">
<PyParameter name="message" type="str">
  
</PyParameter>
<PyParameter name="dest_ids" type="list[int]">
  
</PyParameter>
<PyFunctionReturn type="None">

</PyFunctionReturn>
</PyFunction>
## read_messages

<PyFunction docString="Retrieve messages from the message buffer.

Args:
    round_num (int, optional): The round number to retrieve messages from.
        Defaults to -1, which returns messages from all rounds.

Returns:
    list[Message]: List of messages.">
<PyParameter name="round_num" type="int" value="-1">
  
</PyParameter>
<PyFunctionReturn type="list[Message]">

</PyFunctionReturn>
</PyFunction>
## on_map

<PyFunction docString="Check whether a location is within the bounds of the world.

Args:
    loc: The location to check.

Returns:
    `True` if the location is on the map, `False` otherwise.">
<PyParameter name="loc" type="Location">
  
</PyParameter>
<PyFunctionReturn type="bool">

</PyFunctionReturn>
</PyFunction>
## get_cell_info_at

<PyFunction docString="Return the cell info at a given location.

If the location is adjacent (1 tile away) to the agent,
or has been scanned by a drone, all layers and visible agents.

If the location is not adjacent or hasn't been scanned, only the top layer is returned,
and agent presence is hidden.

Args:
    loc: The location to query.

Returns:
    The `CellInfo` at the specified location, potentially with limited information
    depending on visibility rules.">
<PyParameter name="loc" type="Location">
  
</PyParameter>
<PyFunctionReturn type="CellInfo">

</PyFunctionReturn>
</PyFunction>

## read_pending_predictions

<PyFunction docString="Retrieve the list of pending predictions stored by the agent's team.

Returns:
    list[tuple[int, NDArray[np.uint8], NDArray[np.int32]]]: A list of tuples representing pending survivor predictions (surv_id, image_to_predict, all_unique_labels).
        Returns an empty list if no pending predictions are available.">

<PyFunctionReturn type="list[tuple[int, NDArray[np.uint8], NDArray[np.int32]]]">

</PyFunctionReturn>
</PyFunction>
